body:
Problem: If the server wants to ask client to pull diagnostics, e.g. the server detects configuration has been changed so it needs to re-calculate diagnostics with new configuration, there's no way to tell client to refresh.

Solution: This PR added a handler for `workspace/diagnostic/refresh` server-to-client request.

comment_regular_data.body:
Can you review the discussion in https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/22388 and explain if this PR addresses the points raise there. cc @mfussenegger 

Could this potentially close any of these issues (or others?):

- https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/30385
- https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/32247
- https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/29792

> Can you review the discussion in https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/22388 and explain if this PR addresses the points raise there. cc @mfussenegger

The points I made in that PR no longer apply because we've since added document-pull & workspace diagnostic support.

But I'm a bit confused about the change in the PR here.
The logic here would refresh the document-pull diagnostics if I'm reading the diff right. But we already pull these on any buffer changes:

https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/2c6469aca451027648c3317f11ffb6b35b7f835b/runtime/lua/vim/lsp/diagnostic.lua?plain=1#L402-L417

I'd expect `workspace/diagnostic/refresh` to trigger a refresh of the _workspace_ diagnostics  - except we currently only pull these on-demand when requested by the user. So not sure if a automated refresh is desired?

https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/2c6469aca451027648c3317f11ffb6b35b7f835b/runtime/lua/vim/lsp/buf.lua?plain=1#L1073-L1077

Would be good to have a "Problem: ... Solution: .." statement in the PR & commit description to better understand what we're trying to achieve here.

The refresh request is from server to client. For example, the server detects configuration changed, then server can ask client "please pull diagnostics again because configuration changed", and that ask is the `workspace/diagnostic/refresh` change.

While the name is called `workspace/diagnostic/refresh`, it isn't limited to "workspace" level. Looking at inlay hints, the request is `textDocument/inlayHint` while the refresh request is `workspace/inlayHint/refresh`, but there isn't something like workspace level inlay hints. Also, not all servers support workspace level diagnostics, but they still need refreshing.

PR description is edited.

> While the name is called workspace/diagnostic/refresh, it isn't limited to "workspace" level.

Yes - and that implies that it also isn't exclusive to document diagnostics but the PR currently only refreshes document diagnostics - which due them already refreshing on any buffer edit benefit the least from a dedicated server initiated refresh.

> Also, not all servers support workspace level diagnostics, but they still need refreshing.

But what if they do?

Example scenario:

- User gets workspace diagnostics via `vim.lsp.buf.workspace_diagnostics`
- User changes a config file to disable a specific linting rule
- Server sends `workspace/diagnostic/refresh`
- `vim.diagnostic.get()` still reports all warnings for the disabled rules, because workspace diagnostics weren't updated.
